t: He*pn who dwells in the shelter of the Most High will*ld abide in the shadow of the Almighty.
I*ln will say to the Lord,*s “My refuge and my fortress, my*ld God, in whom I trust.”
For*pn he will deliver you from the snare of the fowler and*ld from the deadly pestilence.
He*ln will cover you with his pinions, and*ld under his wings you will find refuge; his*ld faithfulness is a shield and buckler.
You*ln will not fear the terror of the night, nor*ld the arrow that flies by day,
nor*ln the pestilence that stalks in darkness, nor*ld the destruction that wastes at noonday.
A*pn thousand may fall at your side, ten*ld thousand at your right hand, but*ld it will not come near you.
You*ln will only look with your eyes and*ld see the recompense of the wicked.
Because*pn you have made the Lord*s your dwelling place— the*ld Most High, who is my refuge—
no*ln evil shall be allowed to befall you, no*ld plague come near your tent.
For*pn he will command his angels concerning you to*ld guard you in all your ways.
On*ln their hands they will bear you up, lest*ld you strike your foot against a stone.
You*ln will tread on the lion and the adder; the*ld young lion and the serpent you will trample underfoot.
“Because*pn he holds fast to me in love, I will deliver him; I*ld will protect him, because he knows my name.
When*ln he calls to me, I will answer him; I*ld will be with him in trouble; I*ld will rescue him and honor him.
With*ln long life I will satisfy him and*ld show him my salvation.”
